bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to limit certain campaign contributions. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 12-25 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: No person may make a contribution of more than one hundred dollars to any individual candidate, unless the person is an elector from the district in which the individual candidate is running for office. This section does not apply to any person who is a relative of the candidate within the third degree of kinship. 250 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.038 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

action_log.status_text: First read in House and referred to
Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date
